item.title: Jane add a quote by Raymond Carver
item.description: "I could hear my heart beating. I could hear everyone's heart. I could hear the human noise we sat there making, not one of us moving, not even when the room went dark." -- Raymond Carver

item.title: Jane add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Jane add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I think we ought to read only the kind of books that wound and stab us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Jane add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Try to understand men. If you understand each other you will be kind to each other. Knowing a man well never leads to hate and almost always leads to love." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Jane add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "A human being is a part of the whole called by us universe, a part limited in time and space. He experiences himself, his thoughts and feeling as something separated from the rest, a kind of optical delusion of his consciousness. This delusion is a kind of prison for us, restricting us to our personal desires and to affection for a few persons nearest to us. Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jane add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I regret that it takes a life to learn how to live." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Jane add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I like to see people reunited, I like to see people run to each other, I like the kissing and the crying, I like the impatience, the stories that the mouth can't tell fast enough, the ears that aren't big enough, the eyes that can't take in all of the change, I like the hugging, the bringing together, the end of missing someone." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Jane add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "What about little microphones? What if everyone swallowed them, and they played the sounds of our hearts through little speakers, which could be in the pouches of our overalls? When you skateboarded down the street at night you could hear everyone's heartbeat, and they could hear yours, sort of like sonar. One weird thing is, I wonder if everyone's hearts would start to beat at the same time, like how women who live together have their menstrual periods at the same time, which I know about, but don't really want to know about. That would be so weird, except that the place in the hospital where babies are born would sound like a crystal chandelier in a houseboat, because the babies wouldn't have had time to match up their heartbeats yet. And at the finish line at the end of the New York City Marathon it would sound like war." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Jane add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I took the world into me, rearranged it, and sent it back out as a question: "Do you like me?" -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Jane add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Songs are as sad as the listener." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Jane add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I knew that our time together was almost over, I asked her if she liked sports, she asked me if I liked chess, I asked her if she liked fallen trees, she went home with her father, the center of me followed her, but I was left with the shell of me, I needed to see her again, I couldn't explain my need to myself, and that's why it was such a beautiful need, there's nothing wrong with not understanding yourself." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Jane add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jane add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jane add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "My aim is to put down on paper what I see and what I feel in the best and simplest way." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jane add a quote by Raymond Carver
item.description:
"<b>Late Fragment</b>
And did you get what you wanted from this life, even so? I did. And what did you want? To call myself beloved, to feel myself beloved on the earth." -- Raymond Carver

item.title: Jane add a quote by Erich Fromm
item.description: "Love is a decision, it is a judgment, it is a promise. If love were only a feeling, there would be no basis for the promise to love each other forever. A feeling comes and it may go. How can I judge that it will stay forever, when my act does not involve judgment and decision." -- Erich Fromm

item.title: Jane add a quote by Erich Fromm
item.description: "Immature love says: 'I love you because I need you.' Mature love says 'I need you because I love you." -- Erich Fromm

item.title: Jane add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage." -- Lao Tzu
